description: Text against and for Net Neutrality

lines: In the United States, there are currently laws to protect Net Neutrality, which were created during the Obama administration
These laws prohibited internet providers from blocking or slowing down access to the internet. Additionally, the internet was defined
as a utility, like water and electricity. Which gives the opportunity for the government to regulate it.
1. Net Neutrality makes sure that all people have equal access to the Internet, and all data is the same.
2. There is a greater competition for internet providers, which would bring down the cost for internet services.
One example, in 2014 Comcast slowed down the speeds of Netflix in order to try to push consumers to Comcast's on-demand
service and to force Netflix into a deal with Comcast. A similar thing happened between Verizon, Youtube, and Netflix, in early 2017.
Another example is between At&T and Apple over facetime. Which happened when At&t limited the use of facetime for consumers
,unless the consumers switched to At&T's new sharing plan. These events are happening all the time, around the U.S and the world.
Yahoo, Vonage, eBay, Amazon, Netflix, Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter, and many other companies.
